Extending results at product level with columns from input datasets

Source: vignettes/articles/extending-outputs.Rmd
extending-outputs.Rmd

This article shows how to extend results at product level with columns from input datasets.

library(tiltIndicator)
library(tiltToyData)
library(tibble, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)

options(readr.show_col_types = FALSE)

Any column in the input datasets ending with *rowid is also passed as is to the output at product level. The exception is any column named exactly rowid– which is a reserved name and throws an error. Note this feature makes no sense at company level because potentially multiple rows in the input datasets are summarized into a single row in the output at company level.

This example shows emissions_profile() but the same goes for other functions.

companies <- read_csv(toy_emissions_profile_any_companies())
products <- read_csv(toy_emissions_profile_products()) |>
  rowid_to_column("products_rowid")

result_at_product_level <- emissions_profile(companies, products) |>
  unnest_product()
result_at_product_level
#> # A tibble: 49 × 7
#>    companies_id                products_rowid grouped_by risk_category clustered
#>    <chr>                                <int> <chr>      <chr>         <chr>    
#>  1 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 all        high          stove    
#>  2 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 isic_4dig… high          stove    
#>  3 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 tilt_sect… high          stove    
#>  4 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 unit       high          stove    
#>  5 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 unit_isic… high          stove    
#>  6 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 unit_tilt… high          stove    
#>  7 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              2 all        high          oven     
#>  8 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              2 isic_4dig… medium        oven     
#>  9 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              2 tilt_sect… medium        oven     
#> 10 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              2 unit       medium        oven     
#> # ℹ 39 more rows
#> # ℹ 2 more variables: activity_uuid_product_uuid <chr>, co2_footprint <dbl>

The *rowid column allows you to extend the output at product level with columns from the input.

extension <- products |> select(matches(c("rowid", "sector", "isic")))
extension
#> # A tibble: 5 × 4
#>   products_rowid tilt_sector    tilt_subsector isic_4digit
#>            <int> <chr>          <chr>                <dbl>
#> 1              1 Industry       Other                 2560
#> 2              2 Industry       Other                 2560
#> 3              3 Steel & Metals Steel                 2870
#> 4              4 Agriculture    Agriculture           1780
#> 5              5 Industry       Other                 2679

extended <- result_at_product_level |> left_join(extension)
#> Joining with `by = join_by(products_rowid)`
extended
#> # A tibble: 49 × 10
#>    companies_id                products_rowid grouped_by risk_category clustered
#>    <chr>                                <int> <chr>      <chr>         <chr>    
#>  1 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 all        high          stove    
#>  2 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 isic_4dig… high          stove    
#>  3 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 tilt_sect… high          stove    
#>  4 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 unit       high          stove    
#>  5 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 unit_isic… high          stove    
#>  6 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              1 unit_tilt… high          stove    
#>  7 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              2 all        high          oven     
#>  8 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              2 isic_4dig… medium        oven     
#>  9 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              2 tilt_sect… medium        oven     
#> 10 fleischerei-stiefsohn_0000…              2 unit       medium        oven     
#> # ℹ 39 more rows
#> # ℹ 5 more variables: activity_uuid_product_uuid <chr>, co2_footprint <dbl>,
#> #   tilt_sector <chr>, tilt_subsector <chr>, isic_4digit <dbl>
